column2: the "total variation in the data" is $$\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^p Var(X_j) = \frac{1}{n}\sum_{j=1}^p \sum_{i=1}^n x_{ij}^2$$
the "variation explained by the $$m^{th}$$ principal component" is $$\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^n z_{im}^2 = \frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^n(\sum_{j=1}^p \phi_{jm}x_{ij})^2
we can use the above to examine "proportion of variance explained" to select how many principal components to retain for dimensionality reduction
